title: iBaba
author: iBaba
content: BEFORE YOU START READING, KEEP IN MIND THAT I DO NOT RECOMMEND NON-DRINKERS TO START DRINKING. BECAUSE DRINKING IS VERY HARMFUL TO YOUR HEALTH.Alcohol consumption and addiction are not new in our social life today, but it is also appropriate to state that alcohol is both a tonic and a poison, with the difference being primarily in the dose.Alcohol is employed in different kinds of festivals, social gatherings, and even for medicinal purposes.  This has raised many questions about the effects of alcohol on every organ in the body. When alcohol enters the body, approximately 80% of it is absorbed in the small intestine and then released into the bloodstream. When alcohol enters the bloodstream, it is circulated throughout the body by the circulatory system, the heart. The human liver is in charge of detoxifying methane (alcohol) and eliminating it from the bloodstream. However, the liver can only handle a tiny quantity of alcohol at a time, allowing remainder to circulate throughout the body.The worst aspect is that it also gets into the central nervous system and brain. Because of the addictive nature of alcohols, heavy drinking is largely almost irresistible by drinkers, resulting to a variety of diseases as a result of the causes I described above.This fact has also make the health benefits of drinking at moderate level not well known. However, moderate drinking can be advantageous to human health, as I will demonstrate below:* Beers can lower the risk of of kidney stones: Beer was found to reduce the risk of kidney stones by 41%.* Beers strengthen your bones: Beer's high source of silicon content is what's responsible for an increase in bone density.* Alcohol can protect you from heart attacks.* Red wines can help fight colds: 8 -14 glasses of wine per week, one could see a 60% reduction in the risk developing a cold.* Red wines can boost your memory: A compound found in the skin of red grapes can improve memory and cognitive function.* Beers have vitamins.* Whisky can cure sore throats.* Drinking moderately can improve sexual function in men.* Drinking can also help in Reducing blood clotting.* Beer can help stop cataracts.Addiction in the use of alcohol is a topic that we cannot run away from, I suggest we open discussion about this topic for the purpose of educating each other.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: Alcohol usage and consumption has already been extensively discussed in the world today. With so many benefits, the downsides should always be dealt with caution. Alcohol addiction is now the norm, and some people believe that if you don't drink alcohol, you're missing out on a lot of the fun you should be having in this life while you're still alive and healthy. Many individuals forget the downsides of it and the long-term effects it can have on the immune system and cause utter destruction to some of the body's essential organs when used excessively. I believe that for everything in the world today, there are always pros and downsides, so it is best if we embrace the benefits and stay away from the risks involved in using such substances when they’re too much in the body.

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: Most of our health problems comes from abuse of various substances throughout our lives. Most things considered bad for you can be good and cure many health conditions if used in moderation.Some examples? Common salt. You need to consume a bit of sodium to stay healthy, otherwise you can even go into a coma. Eat too much salt and you'll have heart problems, high blood pressure, finally, just like with too little sodium, you can fall into a coma. Pure alcohol is bad for us in general, but it can help endure pain, disinfect wounds, and allow us survive longer in extreme conditions, especially in a situation where you're wounded and need to walk somewhere to get help. Taking a sip of strong alcohol can help you focus. You can read about the famous Dutch courage

comments.author: Stepstowealth
comments.body: The only benefit is to your mental health, not your physical health. Alcohol can lift depression temporarily and lighten the mood of a room, and good for social gathering. Alcohol should be consumed in moderate amount because it can be hazardous to health and damaging to the kidney. Red wines out of the whole category of alcohol is the best choice if you must consume alcohol, but still it still does not have to be abused as some people do very frequently and call it enjoyment. Drink and gamble responsibly.

comments.body: I have read before that Red wine has many health benefits of taken in a reasonable quantity and a reasonable frequency.  I recall a documentary film about a person who lived a realively long life because alledgely drank a cup of red wine once a day since was 20 years old. While it cannot be affordable for all of us, (including me), I still like to drink in special occasions. I personally like beer and wine, both classic red or sparkling ones.By the way, I am aware that here in the forum we have many Muslim fellows, who are not allowed to consume alcohol, for obvious reasons. I don't have anything against them. To each their own.

comments.body: Quote from: iBaba on August 07, 2023, 07:23:03 AM* Alcohol can protect you from heart attacks.I read somewhere that moderate drinking can help prevent heart disease.https://www.webmd.com/heart-disease/heart-disease-alcohol-your-heart#:~:text=Can%20a%20few%20drinks%20really,ounces%20of%2080%2Dproof%20liquor.QuoteIt raises HDL or "good" cholesterol.It prevents blood from clotting. This can be good or bad. It may hold off heart attacks, but it could make you bleed more easily.It helps prevent damage caused by high LDL, the "bad" cholesterol.But they still went further to say that Doctors aren't sure if the benefits are because of the alcohol or the healthy lifestyle of minimal drinkers. Therefore, if you don't drink, don't start for the sake of your heart. Eating healthy and exercising can do the trick. And if you already drink too much, don't use the healthy benefits as an excuse because they negative effects outweighs the good.

comments.body: Quote from: Alpha Marine on August 08, 2023, 10:16:06 PMI read somewhere that moderate drinking can help prevent heart disease.https://www.webmd.com/heart-disease/heart-disease-alcohol-your-heartThere isn't even a small level of alcohol that's safe: https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(18)31310-2And so even if a moderate level of alcohol might have therapeutic effects, any such effects would be completely negated by other damage caused to your organs. You either consume little to nothing, or well past any therapeutic dose.Alcohol causes hypertension, so what good could it really do to prevent heart disease?
